intro: Melandrium mongolicum, commonly known as the Mongolian catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the cold regions of East Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and fleshy, adapted to conserve water in its arid or semi-arid habitats. Melandrium mongolicum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is considered a hardy species suitable for cultivation in similar environments.
